alert.note: Alert for Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 4:03PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Newton and northwestern Johnson Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 403 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cass, or 13 miles north of Ozark, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Rosetta... Devils Knob... Upper Buffalo Wilderness Area... Salus... Wolf Pen Campground... Catalpa... Arbaugh... Yale... Friley... Fallsville... Oark... Dixon Ridge... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for western and north central Arkansas.

area.areaDesc: Johnson County Higher Elevations; Newton County Higher Elevations
